intro: Matelea jansen-jacobsiae, commonly known as the Jansen-Jacobsia matelea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The species is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in scrublands and limestone areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
